page.title: 13Energy in the Home (I)
page.content: All homes have electricty with over 60% having both electricity and gas. The major use of electricity is for heating. The second most popular fuel is gas, and then wood. A minority use coal or oil for heating. Nearly all the homes have some double glazing with nearly half those surveyed having full double glazing. Loft insulation is the second most popular method of conserving energy. The most dramatic change that has occurred in the use of energy during the post war period is to power electrical gadgets. Every home surveyed owned at least one TV, with some having 2 or 3. Other electrically powered items that have become fixtures in almost all homes are refridgerators, cookers, kettles, washing machines, hair driers and irons.
